  48def getScreenSize(app):
  49    """
  50    Returns the screen sizes for all connected displays.
  51
  52    Args:
  53        app: QApplication instance.
  54
  55    Returns:
  56        List of QSize objects representing the size of each screen.
  57    """
  58    screens = app.screens()
  59    res = list(map(lambda x: x.size(), screens))
  60    return res
  61# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  62# --- Class GalleryMode -------------------------------------------------------
  63# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  64class GalleryMode(enum.Enum):
  65    """
  66    Enum defining different gallery display layouts.
  67    Each mode corresponds to a specific number of columns and rows.
  68    """
  69
  70    _1x1         = 0         # 
  71    _3x2         = 1         # 
  72    _6x4         = 2         # 
  73    _9x6         = 3         #
  74    
  75    _2x1        =  4
  76
  77    def nbRow(m):
  78        """
  79        Returns the number of rows for a given gallery mode.
  80        """
  81        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
  82        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 2
  83        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 4
  84        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 6
  85
  86        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 1
  87    def nbCol(m):
  88        """
  89        Returns the number of columns for a given gallery mode.
  90        """
  91        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
  92        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 3
  93        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 6
  94        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 9
  95
  96        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 2
  97# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  98# --- Class ImageWidgetController ---------------------------------------------
  99# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 100class ImageWidgetController:
 101    """ image widget controller """
 102
 103    def __init__(self, image=None,id = -1):
 104        """
 105        Initialize the image widget controller.
 106
 107        Args:
 108            image: Optional image to load (np.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image).
 109            id: Unique identifier for the image widget.
 110        """
 111
 112        self.model = model.ImageWidgetModel(self)
 113        self.view = view.ImageWidgetView(self)
 114
 115        self._id = id # store an (unique) id 
 116
 117        if isinstance(image, (np.ndarray, hdrCore.image.Image)):
 118            self.model.setImage(image)
 119            self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
 120
 121    def setImage(self, image):
 122        """
 123        Sets an image in the model and updates the view.
 124
 125        Args:
 126            image: New image to set.
 127        """
 128        self.model.setImage(image)
 129        return self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
 130
 131    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 132        """
 133        Sets a QPixmap directly into the view.
 134        """
 135        self.view.setQPixmap(qPixmap)
 136
 137    def id(self): 
 138        """
 139        Returns the ID of the image widget.
 140        """
 141        return self._id
 142# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 143# --- Class ImageGalleryController --------------------------------------------
 144# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 145class ImageGalleryController():
 146    """ image gallery controller """
 147
 148    def __init__(self, parent):
 149        """
 150        Initialize the gallery controller.
 151
 152        Args:
 153            parent: Reference to the main application view.
 154        """
 155        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.__init__()")
 156
 157        self.parent = parent    # AppView
 158        self.view = view.ImageGalleryView(self)
 159        self.model = model.ImageGalleryModel(self)
 160
 161    def setImages(self, imageFiles): 
 162        """Set the images to be loaded into the model."""
 163        self.model.setImages(imageFiles)
 164
 165    def updateImages(self):
 166        """
 167        Request an update of images on the view side.
 168        Called by the model when new images are set or changed.
 169        """
 170        self.view.pageNumber = 0 # reset page number
 171        self.view.updateImages()
 172
 173    def callBackButton_previousPage(self): 
 174        """Callback for previous page button."""
 175        self.view.changePageNumber(-1)
 176        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
 177
 178    def callBackButton_nextPage(self): 
 179        """Callback for next page button."""
 180        self.view.changePageNumber(+1)
 181        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
 182
 183    def computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(self,newGalleryMode):
 184        """
 185        Compute new page number when gallery layout mode changes.
 186
 187        Args:
 188            newGalleryMode: The newly selected GalleryMode.
 189
 190        Returns:
 191            int: The page number to display in the new mode.
 192        """
 193        currentPage = self.view.pageNumber
 194        nbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 195        selectedImage = self.model.selectedImage() if (self.model.selectedImage()!=-1) else currentPage*nbImagePerPage
 196        newNbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(newGalleryMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(newGalleryMode)
 197
 198        newPageNumber = selectedImage//newNbImagePerPage
 199
 200        return newPageNumber
 201
 202    def callBackButton_1x1(self):
 203        """Callback for 1x1 gallery layout."""
 204        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._1x1:
 205            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 206            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._1x1)
 207            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._1x1
 208            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 209            self.view.updateImages()
 210            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 211            self.view.repaint()
 212
 213    def callBackButton_3x2(self): 
 214        """Callback for 3x2 gallery layout."""
 215        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._3x2:
 216            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 217            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._3x2)
 218            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._3x2
 219            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 220            self.view.updateImages()
 221            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 222            self.view.repaint()
 223
 224    def callBackButton_6x4(self): 
 225        """Callback for 6x4 gallery layout."""
 226        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._6x4:
 227            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 228            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._6x4)
 229            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._6x4
 230            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 231            self.view.updateImages()
 232            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 233            self.view.repaint()
 234
 235    def callBackButton_9x6(self):
 236        """Callback for 9x6 gallery layout."""
 237        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._9x6:
 238            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 239            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._9x6)
 240            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._9x6
 241            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 242            self.view.updateImages()
 243            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 244            self.view.repaint()
 245
 246    def callBackButton_2x1(self):
 247        """Callback for 2x1 gallery layout."""
 248        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._2x1:
 249            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
 250            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._2x1)
 251            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._2x1
 252            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
 253            self.view.updateImages()
 254            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
 255            self.view.repaint()
 256
 257    def selectImage(self, id):
 258        """
 259        Select an image by its index within the current page.
 260
 261        Args:
 262            id: Index within the page grid.
 263        """
 264        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.selectImage()")
 265
 266        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 267        idxImage = self.view.pageNumber*nbImagePage+id
 268        # check id
 269        if (idxImage < len(self.model.processPipes)):
 270            # update selected image
 271            processPipe = self.model.processPipes[idxImage]
 272            if processPipe:
 273                if self.parent.dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
 274                    self.model.setSelectedImage(idxImage)
 275
 276    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
 277        """
 278        Returns the currently selected process pipe.
 279
 280        Returns:
 281            ProcessPipe or None
 282        """
 283        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()")
 284        return self.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 285
 286    def setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
 287        """
 288        Updates the displayed QPixmap for the selected process pipe.
 289
 290        Args:
 291            qPixmap: The QPixmap to show.
 292        """
 293        idxProcessPipe = self.model.selectedImage()
 294        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 295        idxImageWidget = idxProcessPipe%nbImagePage
 296        if pref.verbose:  print(" >> ImageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(...)[ image id:",idxProcessPipe,">> image widget controller:",idxImageWidget,"]")
 297        self.view.imagesControllers[idxImageWidget].setQPixmap(qPixmap)
 298
 299    def save(self):
 300        """
 301        Trigger saving via the model.
 302        """
 303        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.save()")
 304        self.model.save()
 305
 306    def currentPage(self): 
 307        """Return the current page number."""
 308        return self.view.currentPage()
 309        
 310
 311    def pageIdx(self):
 312        """
 313        Return the range (start, end) of image indices for the current page.
 314        """
 315        nb = self.currentPage()
 316        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
 317        return (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
 318
 319    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self): 
 320        """Return filenames of images displayed on the current page."""
 321        return self.model.getFilenamesOfCurrentPage()
 322
 323    def getProcessPipeById(self,i) : 
 324        """Return a specific ProcessPipe by its index."""
 325        return self.model.getProcessPipeById(i)
 326
 327    def getProcessPipes(self): 
 328        """Return the full list of process pipes."""
 329        return self.model.processPipes
 330# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 331# --- Class AppController -----------------------------------------------------
 332# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 333class AppController(object):
 334    """controller for MainWindow
 335    
 336        Attributes:
 337            screenSize 
 338            hdrDisplay 
 339            view                          
 340            model
 341            
 342        Methods:
 343            callBackSelectDir(self)
 344            callBackSave(self)
 345            callBackDisplayHDR(self)
 346            callBackEndDisplay(self, img)
 347            callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self)
 348            callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self)
 349            callBackExportHDR(self)
 350            callBackEndExportHDR(self, img)
 351            callBackExportAllHDR(self)            
 352            callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img)  
 353
 354    """
 355
 356    def __init__(self, app):
 357        """Initialize the AppController with the application context."""
 358        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.__init__()")
 359
 360        self.screenSize = getScreenSize(app)# get screens size
 361
 362        # attributes
 363        self.hdrDisplay = HDRviewerController(self)
 364        self.view =  view.AppView(self, HDRcontroller = self.hdrDisplay)                         
 365        self.model = model.AppModel(self)
 366
 367        self.dirName = None
 368        self.imagesName = []
 369        
 370        self.view.show()
 371    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 372
 373    def callBackSelectDir(self):
 374        """Callback of export HDR menu: open file dialog, store image filenames (self.imagesName), set directory to model
 375        """
 376        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackSelectDir()")
 377        dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory', self.model.directory)
 378        if dirName != "":
 379            # save current images (metadata)
 380            self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 381            # get images in the selected directory
 382            self.imagesName = []; self.imagesName = list(self.model.setDirectory(dirName))
 383
 384            self.view.imageGalleryController.setImages(self.imagesName)
 385            self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
 386    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 387    def callBackSave(self): 
 388        """Callback to save current image data."""
 389        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 390    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 391    def callBackQuit(self):
 392        """Callback to save data and quit the application."""
 393        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppController.callBackQuit()")
 394        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
 395        self.hdrDisplay.close()
 396        sys.exit()
 397    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 398    def callBackDisplayHDR(self):
 399        """Callback to load and display the full HDR image of the selected process pipe."""
 400        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackDisplayHDR()")
 401
 402        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 403
 404        if selectedProcessPipe:
 405            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
 406            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 407            # save current processpipe metada
 408            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
 409            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
 410            originalImage.metadata.save()
 411
 412            # load full size image
 413            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 414
 415            # turn off: autoResize
 416            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 417            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 418            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
 419
 420            # set size to display size
 421            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
 422            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
 423
 424            # set image to process-pipe
 425            processpipe.setImage(img)
 426
 427            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
 428    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 429    def callBackEndDisplay(self, img):
 430        """Post-processing after full HDR image computation and trigger HDR viewer display.
 431
 432        Args:
 433            img: The processed HDR image object.
 434        """
 435
 436        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackEndDisplay()")
 437
 438        # turn off: autoResize
 439        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
 440        
 441        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: done !')
 442
 443        # clip, scale
 444        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 445        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 446
 447        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
 448        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
 449    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 450    def callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self):
 451        """Callback to close the HDR display and return to splash screen."""
 452        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCloseDisplayHDR()")
 453        self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
 454    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 455    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
 456        """
 457        Callback of compare raw/edited HDR menu
 458
 459        Display side by side original image and edited version.        
 460        """
 461
 462        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
 463
 464        # process real size image
 465        # get selected process pipe
 466        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 467
 468        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
 469
 470            # read original image
 471            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
 472
 473            # resize
 474            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
 475
 476            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
 477
 478            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
 479            marginX = int(marginY/4)
 480            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
 481            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
 482            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
 483
 484            # original image after resize
 485            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
 486
 487            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
 488            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
 489            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
 490            params= []
 491            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
 492                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
 493                params.append({p.name:p.params})
 494            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
 495            pp.setImage(img)
 496
 497            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
 498            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 499            
 500            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
 501
 502            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
 503
 504            # make comparison image
 505            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 506            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 507            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
 508            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
 509            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
 510
 511            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
 512            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
 513            
 514            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
 515            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
 516            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')
 517    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 518    def callBackExportHDR(self):
 519        """
 520        Callback of export HDR menu
 521
 522        Export the image associated to selected process pipe
 523        """
 524
 525        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportHDR()") 
 526
 527        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
 528
 529
 530        if selectedProcessPipe:
 531            # select dir where to save export
 532            self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
 533
 534            # show export message
 535            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: start, please wait !')
 536            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 537
 538            # save current processpipe metada
 539            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
 540            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
 541            originalImage.metadata.save()
 542
 543            # load full size image
 544            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 545
 546            # turn off: autoResize
 547            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 548            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 549            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
 550
 551            # set image to process-pipe
 552            processpipe.setImage(img)
 553
 554            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
 555    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 556    def callBackEndExportHDR(self, img):
 557        """Post-processing after exporting a single HDR image.
 558
 559        Args:
 560            img: The processed HDR image to be saved.
 561        """
 562        # turn off: autoResize
 563        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
 564        
 565        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: done !')
 566
 567        # clip, scale
 568        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 569        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 570
 571        if self.dirName:
 572            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
 573            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
 574            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
 575            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
 576
 577            img.write(pathExport)
 578
 579        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
 580        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
 581    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 582    def callBackExportAllHDR(self):
 583        """Callback to export all HDR images in the gallery."""
 584        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportAllHDR()")
 585
 586        self.processPipes = self.view.imageGalleryController.getProcessPipes()
 587
 588        # select dir where to save export
 589        self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
 590        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting '+str(len(self.processPipes))+' HDR images ... please wait')
 591        self.view.statusBar().repaint()
 592        self.imageToExport = len(self.processPipes) ; self.imageExportDone = 0
 593
 594        pp = self.processPipes[0]
 595
 596        # save current processpipe metada
 597        originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
 598        originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
 599        originalImage.metadata.save()
 600
 601        # load full size image
 602        img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 603
 604        # turn off: autoResize
 605        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 606        # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 607        processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
 608
 609        # set image to process-pipe
 610        processpipe.setImage(img)
 611
 612        thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)            
 613    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 614    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
 615        """Handles the export process for all HDR images one by one.
 616
 617        Args:
 618            img: The current HDR image to process and export.
 619        """
 620        # last image ?
 621        self.imageExportDone +=1
 622
 623        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
 624
 625        # clip, scale
 626        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
 627        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
 628
 629        if self.dirName:
 630            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
 631            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
 632            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
 633            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
 634
 635            img.write(pathExport)
 636
 637        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
 638            # turn off: autoResize
 639            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
 640        else:
 641            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
 642
 643            if not pp:
 644                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
 645                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
 646                pp.setImage(img)                      
 647
 648
 649            # save current processpipe metada
 650            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
 651            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
 652            originalImage.metadata.save()
 653
 654            # load full size image
 655            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
 656
 657            # turn off: autoResize
 658            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
 659            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
 660            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
 661
 662            # set image to process-pipe
 663            processpipe.setImage(img)
 664
 665            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

 896class AdvanceSliderController():
 897    def __init__(self, parent,name, defaultValue, range, step,callBackValueChange=None,callBackAutoPush= None):
 898        """Initialize the slider with parameters and optional callbacks.
 899
 900        Args:
 901            parent: Parent widget or controller.
 902            name (str): Label for the slider.
 903            defaultValue (float): Initial value.
 904            range (tuple): Min and max range for the slider.
 905            step (float): Step size for slider movement.
 906            callBackValueChange (callable): Callback when value changes.
 907            callBackAutoPush (callable): Callback when 'auto' is triggered.
 908        """
 909        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.__init__(",") ")
 910        self.parent = parent
 911
 912        self.view = view.AdvanceSliderView(self,  name, defaultValue, range, step)
 913        self.model = model.AdvanceSliderModel(self, value=defaultValue)
 914
 915        self.step = step
 916        self.defaultValue = defaultValue
 917        self.range = range
 918
 919        self.callBackActive = True
 920        self.callBackValueChange = callBackValueChange
 921        self.callBackAutoPush = callBackAutoPush
 922    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 923    def sliderChange(self):
 924        """Handle slider change, update value, and trigger callback."""
 925        value = self.view.slider.value()*self.step
 926
 927        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.sliderChange(",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
 928
 929        self.model.value = value
 930        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
 931        if self.callBackActive and self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(value)
 932    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 933    def setValue(self, value, callBackActive = True):
 934        """Set the slider to a specific value.
 935
 936        Args:
 937            value (float): New value to apply.
 938            callBackActive (bool): Whether to trigger the change callback.
 939        """
 940        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.setValue(",value,") ")
 941
 942        """ set value value in 'model' range"""
 943        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
 944        self.view.slider.setValue(int(value/self.step))
 945        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
 946        self.model.setValue(int(value))
 947
 948        self.callBackActive = True
 949    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 950    def reset(self):
 951        """Reset the slider to its default value and trigger the callback."""
 952        if pref.verbose : print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.reset(",") ")
 953
 954        self.setValue(self.defaultValue,callBackActive = False)
 955        if self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(self.defaultValue)
 956    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 957    def auto(self):
 958        """Trigger the auto-adjustment callback."""
 959        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.auto(",") ")
 960
 961        if self.callBackAutoPush: self.callBackAutoPush()

 965class ToneCurveController():
 966    def __init__(self, parent):
 967        """
 968        Initialize the tone curve controller.
 969
 970        Args:
 971            parent: Reference to the parent application or controller.
 972        """
 973        self.parent = parent
 974        self.model = model.ToneCurveModel()
 975        self.view = view.ToneCurveView(self)
 976        self.callBackActive = True
 977
 978        # tone curve display control
 979        self.showInput =False
 980        self.showbefore = False
 981        self.showAfter = False
 982        self.showOutput = True
 983
 984        # zj add semi-auto curve
 985        # machine learning network and weight file 
 986        self.weightFile = 'MSESig505_0419.pth'
 987        self.networkModel = None  
 988    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 989    def sliderChange(self, key, value):
 990        """
 991        Callback triggered when a tone curve slider is moved in the UI.
 992
 993        Args:
 994            key (str): The name of the tone range (e.g., 'shadows').
 995            value (float): The new value from the slider.
 996        """
 997        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> ToneCurveController.sliderChange(",key,",",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
 998
 999        if self.callBackActive:
1000            newValues = self.model.setValue(key, value, autoScale = False)
1001            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(newValues) 
1002  
1003            points = self.model.evaluate()
1004
1005            self.callBackActive =  False
1006
1007            self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(newValues["shadows"][1]) * 100)
1008            self.view.editShadows.setText(str(round(newValues["shadows"][1],2)))
1009
1010            self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(newValues["blacks"][1]) * 100)
1011            self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(round(newValues["blacks"][1],2)))
1012
1013            self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(newValues["mediums"][1]) * 100)
1014            self.view.editMediums.setText(str(round(newValues["mediums"][1],2)))
1015
1016            self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(newValues["whites"][1]) * 100)
1017            self.view.editWhites.setText(str(round(newValues["whites"][1],2)))
1018
1019            self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(newValues["highlights"][1]) * 100)
1020            self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(round(newValues["highlights"][1],2)))
1021
1022            self.callBackActive =  True
1023    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1024    def setValues(self, valuesDict,callBackActive = False):
1025        """
1026        Set all tone curve control points programmatically.
1027
1028        Args:
1029            valuesDict (dict): Dictionary of control points.
1030            callBackActive (bool): Whether to enable slider callbacks during update.
1031        """

1037        points = self.model.evaluate()
1038
1039        self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(valuesDict["shadows"][1]) * 100)
1040        self.view.editShadows.setText(str(round(valuesDict["shadows"][1],2)))
1041
1042        self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(valuesDict["blacks"][1]) * 100)
1043        self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(round(valuesDict["blacks"][1],2)))
1044
1045        self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(valuesDict["mediums"][1]) * 100)
1046        self.view.editMediums.setText(str(round(valuesDict["mediums"][1],2)))
1047
1048        self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(valuesDict["whites"][1]) * 100)
1049        self.view.editWhites.setText(str(round(valuesDict["whites"][1],2)))
1050
1051        self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(valuesDict["highlights"][1])* 100)
1052        self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(round(valuesDict["highlights"][1],2)))
1053
1054        self.callBackActive = True
1055    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
1056    # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1057    def autoCurve(self):
1058        """
1059        Automatically predict and apply a tone curve using a neural network model
1060        based on the image's lightness histogram.
1061        """
1062        processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
1063        if processPipe != None :
1064            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1065            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
1066
1067            imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
1068            imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
1069            imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1070            nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
1071            nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
1072
1073            npImgHistCumuNorm = np.empty_like(nphistBefore)
1074            npImgHistCumu = np.cumsum(nphistBefore)
1075            npImgHistCumuNorm = npImgHistCumu/np.max(npImgHistCumu)
1076            
1077            #predict keypoint value
1078            if self.networkModel == None:
1079                self.networkModel = Net(50,5)
1080                self.networkModel.load_state_dict(torch.load(self.weightFile))
1081                self.networkModel.eval()
1082
1083            with torch.no_grad():
1084                x = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([npImgHistCumuNorm.tolist(),]), requires_grad=True)
1085                y_predict = self.networkModel(x)
1086
1087            kpc = (y_predict[0]*100).tolist() 
1088            kpcDict = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,kpc[0]], 'blacks': [30.0,kpc[1]], 'mediums': [50.0,kpc[2]], 'whites': [70.0,kpc[3]], 'highlights': [90.0,kpc[4]], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
1089            self.setValues(kpcDict,callBackActive = True)
1090            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(kpcDict) 
1091     
1092    # zj add for semi-auto curve end   
1093
1094    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1095    def reset(self, key):
1096        """
1097        Reset the tone curve point for a specific range to its default value.
1098
1099        Args:
1100            key (str): The name of the tone range to reset (e.g., 'shadows').
1101        """
1102        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.reset(",key,") ")
1103
1104        valuesDefault = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default[key])[1]
1105        controls = self.model.setValue(key, valuesDefault)
1106        self.setValues(controls,callBackActive = False)
1107
1108        self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(controls) 
1109    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1110    def plotCurve(self):
1111        """
1112        Plot the current tone curve and corresponding histograms in the UI,
1113        including optional overlays of input, before, and output images.
1114        """
1115        try:
1116            self.view.curve.plot([0,100],[0,100],'r--', clear=True)
1117            self.view.curve.plot([20,20],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1118            self.view.curve.plot([40,40],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1119            self.view.curve.plot([60,60],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1120            self.view.curve.plot([80,80],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1121
1122            processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
1123            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1124
1125            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
1126
1127            if self.showInput:
1128                imageInput = copy.deepcopy(processPipe.getInputImage())
1129                if imageInput.linear: imageInputColorData =colour.cctf_encoding(imageInput.colorData, function='sRGB')
1130                else: imageInputColorData = imageInput.colorData
1131                imageInputColorData[imageInputColorData>1]=1
1132                imageInputY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageInputColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1133                nphistInput  = np.histogram(imageInputY, bins)[0]
1134                nphistInput  = nphistInput/np.amax(nphistInput)
1135                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistInput*100,'k--',  clear=False)
1136
1137            if self.showbefore:
1138                imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
1139                imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
1140                imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1141                nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
1142                nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
1143                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistBefore*100,'b--',  clear=False)
1144
1145            if self.showAfter:
1146                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure].outputImage.colorData
1147                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
1148                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1149                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
1150                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
1151                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
1152
1153            if self.showOutput:
1154                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.getImage(toneMap=True).colorData
1155                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
1156                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1157                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
1158                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
1159                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
1160
1161            controlPointCoordinates= np.asarray(list(self.model.control.values()))
1162            self.view.curve.plot(controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,0],controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,1],'ro', clear=False)
1163            points = np.asarray(self.model.curve.evalpts)
1164            x = points[:,0]
1165            self.view.curve.plot(points[x<100,0],points[x<100,1],'r',clear=False)
1166        except:
1167            time.sleep(0.5)
1168            self.plotCurve()

1225class HDRviewerController():
1226    def __init__(self, parent):
1227        """
1228        Initialize the HDR viewer controller.
1229
1230        Args:
1231            parent: Reference to the main application.
1232        """
1233        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> HDRviewerController.__init__(",")")
1234
1235        self.parent= parent
1236        self.model = model.HDRviewerModel(self)
1237        self.view = None 
1238
1239        self.viewerProcess = None
1240
1241        self.displaySplash()
1242
1243    def setView(self, view): 
1244        """
1245        Set the viewer's UI view.
1246
1247        Args:
1248            view: The viewer UI object.
1249        """
1250        self.view = view
1251
1252    def callBackUpdate(self):
1253        """
1254        Update the viewer with the currently selected image from the process pipe.
1255        """
1256        selectedProcessPipe = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1257        img = selectedProcessPipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
1258        self.displayIMG(img)
1259        self.model.currentIMG = img
1260
1261    def callBackAuto(self,on_off):
1262        """
1263        Enable or disable auto-preview in the HDR viewer.
1264
1265        Args:
1266            on_off (bool): Auto-preview state.
1267        """
1268        self.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR = on_off
1269
1270    def callBackCompare(self):
1271        """
1272        Compare the current HDR image with the updated result side-by-side.
1273        """
1274        if self.model.currentIMG:
1275            old = self.model.currentIMG
1276            old = old.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1277
1278            sp = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1279            img = sp.getImage(toneMap = False)
1280            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1281
1282
1283            h1, w1, _ = old.colorData.shape
1284            h2, w2, _ = img.colorData.shape
1285            hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1286            hM = int((hD - max(h1,h2))/2)
1287            wM = int((wD - (w1+w2))/3)
1288            back =  np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1289
1290            back[hM:hM+h1,wM:wM+w1,:] = old.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1291            back[hM:hM+h2,2*wM+w1:2*wM+w1+w2,:] = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1292
1293            # save as temp.hdr
1294            colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1295            self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1296
1297            self.model.currentIMG = img
1298        else: self.callBackUpdate()
1299
1300    def displayFile(self, HDRfilename):
1301        """
1302        HDRviewerController display file: run HDRImageViewer process ti display HDR image (from filename)
1303
1304        Args:
1305            HDRfilename: string
1306                Required  : hdr image filename
1307                
1308        """
1309
1310         # check that no current display process already open
1311        if self.viewerProcess:
1312            # the display HDR process is already running
1313            # close current
1314            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1315            time.sleep(0.05)
1316        # run display HDR process
1317        self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1318        time.sleep(0.10)
1319        psData = subprocess.run(['tasklist'], capture_output=True, universal_newlines=True).stdout
1320        if not 'HDRImageViewer' in psData: 
1321            # re-run display HDR process
1322            self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1323
1324    def displayIMG(self, img):
1325        """
1326        Process and display an in-memory HDR image using the external viewer.
1327
1328        Args:
1329            img: Image object to display.
1330        """
1331        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1332        colorData = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1333
1334        h,w, _ = colorData.shape
1335        hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1336
1337        if w<wD:
1338            back = np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1339            marginW = int((wD-w)/2)
1340            marginH = int((hD-h)/2)
1341
1342            back[marginH:marginH+h,marginW:marginW+w,:]=colorData
1343
1344        # save as temp.hdr
1345        colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1346        self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1347
1348    def displaySplash(self):
1349        """
1350        Display a default placeholder splash image in the HDR viewer.
1351        """
1352        self.model.currentIMG = None
1353        self.displayFile('grey.hdr')
1354
1355    def close(self):
1356        """
1357        Close the external HDR image viewer process, if running.
1358        """
1359        # check that no current display process already open
1360        if self.viewerProcess:
1361            # the display HDR process is already running
1362            # close current
1363            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1364            self.viewerProcess = None

1463    def setValues(self, values, callBackActive = False):
1464        """
1465        Set all controller values from a dictionary.
1466
1467        Args:
1468            values (dict): Dictionary of values to set.
1469            callBackActive (bool): Whether to activate callbacks during setting.
1470        """
1471        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.setValue(",values,") ")
1472
1473        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1474        # slider hue selection
1475        v = values['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,360)
1476        self.view.sliderHueMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
1477        self.view.sliderHueMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1478
1479        # slider chroma selection
1480        v = values['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1481        self.view.sliderChromaMin.setValue(v[0])
1482        self.view.sliderChromaMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1483
1484        # slider lightness
1485        v = values['selection']['lightness'] if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1486        self.view.sliderLightMin.setValue(int(v[0]*3))
1487        self.view.sliderLightMax.setValue(int(v[1]*3))
1488
1489        # hue shift editor
1490        v = values['edit']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1491        self.view.sliderHueShift.setValue(int(v))
1492        self.view.valueHueShift.setText(str(v)) 
1493
1494        # exposure editor
1495        v : int = values['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1496        self.view.sliderExposure.setValue(int(v*30))
1497        self.view.valueExposure.setText(str(v)) 
1498
1499        # contrast editor
1500        v : int = values['edit']['contrast'] if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1501        self.view.sliderContrast.setValue(int(v))
1502        self.view.valueContrast.setText(str(v))  
1503
1504        # saturation editor
1505        v : int = values['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1506        self.view.sliderSaturation.setValue(int(v))
1507        self.view.valueSaturation.setText(str(v))  
1508
1509        # mask
1510        v : bool = values['mask'] if 'mask' in values.keys() else False
1511        self.view.checkboxMask.setChecked(values['mask'])             
1512
1513        self.model.setValues(values)
1514
1515        self.callBackActive = True
1516

1656def messageBox(title, text):
1657    """
1658    Display a message box with an OK button.
1659
1660    Args:
1661        title (str): Title of the dialog.
1662        text (str): Message text to display.
1663    """
1664    msg = QMessageBox()
1665    msg.setText(text)
1666    msg.setStandardButtons(QMessageBox.Ok)
1667    msg.setWindowTitle(title)
1668    msg.setStandardButtons(QMessageBox.Ok)
1669    msg.setEscapeButton(QMessageBox.Close)
1670    msg.exec_()
1671# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1672def okCancelBox(title, text):
1673    """
1674    Display a confirmation dialog with OK and Cancel buttons.
1675
1676    Args:
1677        title (str): Title of the dialog.
1678        text (str): Message text to display.
1679
1680    Returns:
1681        int: The button selected by the user.
1682    """
1683    msg = QMessageBox()
1684    msg.setText(text)
1685    msg.setWindowTitle(title)
1686    msg.setStandardButtons(QMessageBox.Ok | QMessageBox.Cancel)
1687    msg.setEscapeButton(QMessageBox.Close)
1688    return msg.exec_()

1692class  ColorEditorsAutoController:
1693    def __init__(self, parent, controlledColorEditors, stepName ):
1694        """
1695        Initialize the ColorEditorsAutoController.
1696
1697        Args:
1698            parent: The parent controller.
1699            controlledColorEditors (list): List of color editor controllers.
1700            stepName (str): Name of the processing step associated.
1701        """
1702        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.__init__(",") ")
1703
1704        self.parent = parent
1705        self.controlled = controlledColorEditors
1706        self.stepName =stepName
1707
1708        self.model =    model.ColorEditorsAutoModel(self, stepName,len(controlledColorEditors), removeBlack= True)
1709        self.view =     view.ColorEditorsAutoView(self)
1710
1711        self.callBackActive = True
1712    # callbacks
1713    def auto(self): 
1714        """
1715        Apply automatic color adjustments to all controlled editors.
1716        Resets each editor and assigns computed values from the model.
1717        """
1718        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.auto(",") ")
1719        for ce in self.controlled: ce.resetSelection(); ce.resetEdit()
1720        values = self.model.compute()
1721
1722        if values != None:
1723            for i,v in enumerate(values): self.controlled[i].setValues(v, callBackActive = False)
def getScreenSize(app): 
49def getScreenSize(app):
50    """
51    Returns the screen sizes for all connected displays.
52
53    Args:
54        app: QApplication instance.
55
56    Returns:
57        List of QSize objects representing the size of each screen.
58    """
59    screens = app.screens()
60    res = list(map(lambda x: x.size(), screens))
61    return res

71    _1x1         = 0         # 
72    _3x2         = 1         # 
73    _6x4         = 2         # 
74    _9x6         = 3         #
75    
76    _2x1        =  4
77
78    def nbRow(m):
79        """
80        Returns the number of rows for a given gallery mode.
81        """
82        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
83        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 2
84        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 4
85        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 6
86
87        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 1
88    def nbCol(m):
89        """
90        Returns the number of columns for a given gallery mode.
91        """
92        if m == GalleryMode._1x1: return 1
93        if m == GalleryMode._3x2: return 3
94        if m == GalleryMode._6x4: return 6
95        if m == GalleryMode._9x6: return 9
96
97        if m == GalleryMode._2x1: return 2

Enum defining different gallery display layouts. Each mode corresponds to a specific number of columns and rows.

104    def __init__(self, image=None,id = -1):
105        """
106        Initialize the image widget controller.
107
108        Args:
109            image: Optional image to load (np.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image).
110            id: Unique identifier for the image widget.
111        """
112
113        self.model = model.ImageWidgetModel(self)
114        self.view = view.ImageWidgetView(self)
115
116        self._id = id # store an (unique) id 
117
118        if isinstance(image, (np.ndarray, hdrCore.image.Image)):
119            self.model.setImage(image)
120            self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
121
122    def setImage(self, image):
123        """
124        Sets an image in the model and updates the view.
125
126        Args:
127            image: New image to set.
128        """
129        self.model.setImage(image)
130        return self.view.setPixmap(self.model.getColorData())
131
132    def setQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
133        """
134        Sets a QPixmap directly into the view.
135        """
136        self.view.setQPixmap(qPixmap)
137
138    def id(self): 
139        """
140        Returns the ID of the image widget.
141        """
142        return self._id

class ImageGalleryController: 
146class ImageGalleryController():
147    """ image gallery controller """
148
149    def __init__(self, parent):
150        """
151        Initialize the gallery controller.
152
153        Args:
154            parent: Reference to the main application view.
155        """
156        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.__init__()")
157
158        self.parent = parent    # AppView
159        self.view = view.ImageGalleryView(self)
160        self.model = model.ImageGalleryModel(self)
161
162    def setImages(self, imageFiles): 
163        """Set the images to be loaded into the model."""
164        self.model.setImages(imageFiles)
165
166    def updateImages(self):
167        """
168        Request an update of images on the view side.
169        Called by the model when new images are set or changed.
170        """
171        self.view.pageNumber = 0 # reset page number
172        self.view.updateImages()
173
174    def callBackButton_previousPage(self): 
175        """Callback for previous page button."""
176        self.view.changePageNumber(-1)
177        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
178
179    def callBackButton_nextPage(self): 
180        """Callback for next page button."""
181        self.view.changePageNumber(+1)
182        if self.view.shapeMode == GalleryMode._1x1 : self.selectImage(0)
183
184    def computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(self,newGalleryMode):
185        """
186        Compute new page number when gallery layout mode changes.
187
188        Args:
189            newGalleryMode: The newly selected GalleryMode.
190
191        Returns:
192            int: The page number to display in the new mode.
193        """
194        currentPage = self.view.pageNumber
195        nbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
196        selectedImage = self.model.selectedImage() if (self.model.selectedImage()!=-1) else currentPage*nbImagePerPage
197        newNbImagePerPage = GalleryMode.nbRow(newGalleryMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(newGalleryMode)
198
199        newPageNumber = selectedImage//newNbImagePerPage
200
201        return newPageNumber
202
203    def callBackButton_1x1(self):
204        """Callback for 1x1 gallery layout."""
205        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._1x1:
206            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
207            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._1x1)
208            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._1x1
209            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
210            self.view.updateImages()
211            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
212            self.view.repaint()
213
214    def callBackButton_3x2(self): 
215        """Callback for 3x2 gallery layout."""
216        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._3x2:
217            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
218            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._3x2)
219            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._3x2
220            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
221            self.view.updateImages()
222            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
223            self.view.repaint()
224
225    def callBackButton_6x4(self): 
226        """Callback for 6x4 gallery layout."""
227        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._6x4:
228            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
229            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._6x4)
230            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._6x4
231            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
232            self.view.updateImages()
233            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
234            self.view.repaint()
235
236    def callBackButton_9x6(self):
237        """Callback for 9x6 gallery layout."""
238        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._9x6:
239            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
240            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._9x6)
241            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._9x6
242            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
243            self.view.updateImages()
244            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)

247    def callBackButton_2x1(self):
248        """Callback for 2x1 gallery layout."""
249        if self.view.shapeMode != GalleryMode._2x1:
250            self.view.resetGridLayoutWidgets()
251            self.view.pageNumber = self.computePageNumberOnGalleryModeChange(GalleryMode._2x1)
252            self.view.shapeMode = GalleryMode._2x1
253            self.view.buildGridLayoutWidgets()
254            self.view.updateImages()
255            self.model.loadPage(self.view.pageNumber)
256            self.view.repaint()
257
258    def selectImage(self, id):
259        """
260        Select an image by its index within the current page.
261
262        Args:
263            id: Index within the page grid.
264        """
265        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.selectImage()")
266
267        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
268        idxImage = self.view.pageNumber*nbImagePage+id
269        # check id
270        if (idxImage < len(self.model.processPipes)):
271            # update selected image
272            processPipe = self.model.processPipes[idxImage]
273            if processPipe:
274                if self.parent.dock.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
275                    self.model.setSelectedImage(idxImage)
276
277    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
278        """
279        Returns the currently selected process pipe.
280
281        Returns:
282            ProcessPipe or None
283        """
284        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.getSelectedProcessPipe()")
285        return self.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
286
287    def setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(self, qPixmap):
288        """
289        Updates the displayed QPixmap for the selected process pipe.
290
291        Args:
292            qPixmap: The QPixmap to show.
293        """
294        idxProcessPipe = self.model.selectedImage()
295        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
296        idxImageWidget = idxProcessPipe%nbImagePage
297        if pref.verbose:  print(" >> ImageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(...)[ image id:",idxProcessPipe,">> image widget controller:",idxImageWidget,"]")
298        self.view.imagesControllers[idxImageWidget].setQPixmap(qPixmap)
299
300    def save(self):
301        """
302        Trigger saving via the model.
303        """
304        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ImageGalleryController.save()")
305        self.model.save()
306
307    def currentPage(self): 
308        """Return the current page number."""
309        return self.view.currentPage()
310        
311
312    def pageIdx(self):
313        """
314        Return the range (start, end) of image indices for the current page.
315        """
316        nb = self.currentPage()
317        nbImagePage = GalleryMode.nbRow(self.view.shapeMode)*GalleryMode.nbCol(self.view.shapeMode)
318        return (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
319
320    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self): 
321        """Return filenames of images displayed on the current page."""
322        return self.model.getFilenamesOfCurrentPage()
323
324    def getProcessPipeById(self,i) : 
325        """Return a specific ProcessPipe by its index."""
326        return self.model.getProcessPipeById(i)
327
328    def getProcessPipes(self): 
329        """Return the full list of process pipes."""
330        return self.model.processPipes

class AppController: 
334class AppController(object):
335    """controller for MainWindow
336    
337        Attributes:
338            screenSize 
339            hdrDisplay 
340            view                          
341            model
342            
343        Methods:
344            callBackSelectDir(self)
345            callBackSave(self)
346            callBackDisplayHDR(self)
347            callBackEndDisplay(self, img)
348            callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self)
349            callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self)
350            callBackExportHDR(self)
351            callBackEndExportHDR(self, img)
352            callBackExportAllHDR(self)            
353            callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img)  
354
355    """
356
357    def __init__(self, app):
358        """Initialize the AppController with the application context."""
359        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.__init__()")
360
361        self.screenSize = getScreenSize(app)# get screens size
362
363        # attributes
364        self.hdrDisplay = HDRviewerController(self)
365        self.view =  view.AppView(self, HDRcontroller = self.hdrDisplay)                         
366        self.model = model.AppModel(self)
367
368        self.dirName = None
369        self.imagesName = []
370        
371        self.view.show()
372    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
373
374    def callBackSelectDir(self):
375        """Callback of export HDR menu: open file dialog, store image filenames (self.imagesName), set directory to model
376        """
377        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackSelectDir()")
378        dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory', self.model.directory)
379        if dirName != "":
380            # save current images (metadata)
381            self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
382            # get images in the selected directory
383            self.imagesName = []; self.imagesName = list(self.model.setDirectory(dirName))
384
385            self.view.imageGalleryController.setImages(self.imagesName)
386            self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
387    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
388    def callBackSave(self): 
389        """Callback to save current image data."""
390        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
391    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
392    def callBackQuit(self):
393        """Callback to save data and quit the application."""
394        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AppController.callBackQuit()")
395        self.view.imageGalleryController.save()
396        self.hdrDisplay.close()
397        sys.exit()
398    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
399    def callBackDisplayHDR(self):
400        """Callback to load and display the full HDR image of the selected process pipe."""
401        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackDisplayHDR()")
402
403        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
404
405        if selectedProcessPipe:
406            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: start, please wait !')
407            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
408            # save current processpipe metada
409            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
410            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
411            originalImage.metadata.save()
412
413            # load full size image
414            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
415
416            # turn off: autoResize
417            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
418            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
419            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
420
421            # set size to display size
422            size = pref.getDisplayShape()
423            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
424
425            # set image to process-pipe
426            processpipe.setImage(img)
427
428            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndDisplay, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
429    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
430    def callBackEndDisplay(self, img):
431        """Post-processing after full HDR image computation and trigger HDR viewer display.
432
433        Args:
434            img: The processed HDR image object.
435        """
436
437        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackEndDisplay()")
438
439        # turn off: autoResize
440        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
441        
442        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('displaying HDR image, full size image computation: done !')
443
444        # clip, scale
445        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
446        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
447
448        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
449        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
450    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
451    def callBackCloseDisplayHDR(self):
452        """Callback to close the HDR display and return to splash screen."""
453        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCloseDisplayHDR()")
454        self.hdrDisplay.displaySplash()
455    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
456    def callBackCompareRawEditedHDR(self):
457        """
458        Callback of compare raw/edited HDR menu
459
460        Display side by side original image and edited version.        
461        """
462
463        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackCompareOriginalInputHDR()")
464
465        # process real size image
466        # get selected process pipe
467        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
468
469        if selectedProcessPipe:         # check if a process pipe is selected
470
471            # read original image
472            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.path+'/'+selectedProcessPipe.originalImage.name)
473
474            # resize
475            screenY, screenX = pref.getDisplayShape()
476
477            imgY, imgX,_ = img.shape
478
479            marginY = int((screenY - imgY/2)/2)
480            marginX = int(marginY/4)
481            imgXp = int((screenX - 3*marginX)/2)
482            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.resize(),size=(None,imgXp))
483            imgY, imgX, _ = img.shape
484
485            # original image after resize
486            ori = copy.deepcopy(img)
487
488            # build process pipe from selected one them compute
489            pp = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
490            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False   # stop autoResize
491            params= []
492            for p in selectedProcessPipe.processNodes: 
493                pp.append(copy.deepcopy(p.process),paramDict=None, name=copy.deepcopy(p.name))
494                params.append({p.name:p.params})
495            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = params
496            pp.setImage(img)
497
498            res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, pp)
499            res = res.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
500            
501            imgYres, imgXres, _ = res.colorData.shape
502
503            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True    # return to autoResize
504
505            # make comparison image
506            oriColorData = ori.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
507            resColorData = res.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
508            display = np.ones((screenY,screenX,3))*0.2
509            marginY = int((screenY - imgY)/2)
510            marginYres = int((screenY - imgYres)/2)
511
512            display[marginY:marginY+imgY, marginX:marginX+imgX,:] = oriColorData
513            display[marginYres:marginYres+imgYres, 2*marginX+imgX:2*marginX+imgX+imgXres,:] = resColorData
514            
515            # save as compOrigFinal.hdr
516            colour.write_image(display,'compOrigFinal.hdr', method='Imageio')
517            self.hdrDisplay.displayFile('compOrigFinal.hdr')
518    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
519    def callBackExportHDR(self):
520        """
521        Callback of export HDR menu
522
523        Export the image associated to selected process pipe
524        """
525
526        if pref.verbose:  print(" [CONTROL] >> AppController.callBackExportHDR()") 
527
528        selectedProcessPipe = self.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
529
530
531        if selectedProcessPipe:
532            # select dir where to save export
533            self.dirName = QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(None, 'Select Directory where to export HDR file', self.model.directory)
534
535            # show export message
536            self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: start, please wait !')
537            self.view.statusBar().repaint()
538
539            # save current processpipe metada
540            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe.originalImage)
541            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = selectedProcessPipe.toDict()
542            originalImage.metadata.save()
543
544            # load full size image
545            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
546
547            # turn off: autoResize
548            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
549            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
550            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(selectedProcessPipe)
551
552            # set image to process-pipe
553            processpipe.setImage(img)
554
555            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)
556    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
557    def callBackEndExportHDR(self, img):
558        """Post-processing after exporting a single HDR image.
559
560        Args:
561            img: The processed HDR image to be saved.
562        """
563        # turn off: autoResize
564        hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True  
565        
566        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR image ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'), full size image computation: done !')
567
568        # clip, scale
569        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
570        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
571
572        if self.dirName:
573            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
574            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
575            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
576            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
577
578            img.write(pathExport)
579
580        colour.write_image(img.colorData,"temp.hdr", method='Imageio') # local copy for display
581        self.hdrDisplay.displayFile("temp.hdr")
582    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

586

588
589        # select dir where to save export

592        self.view.statusBar().repaint()
593        self.imageToExport = len(self.processPipes) ; self.imageExportDone = 0
594
595        pp = self.processPipes[0]
596
597        # save current processpipe metada
598        originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
599        originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
600        originalImage.metadata.save()

602        # load full size image

605        # turn off: autoResize

614    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
615    def callBackEndAllExportHDR(self, img):
616        """Handles the export process for all HDR images one by one.
617
618        Args:
619            img: The current HDR image to process and export.
620        """
621        # last image ?
622        self.imageExportDone +=1
623
624        self.view.statusBar().showMessage('exporting HDR images ('+pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']+'):'+str(int(100*self.imageExportDone/self.imageToExport))+'% done !')
625
626        # clip, scale
627        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
628        img.colorData = img.colorData*pref.getDisplayScaling()
629
630        if self.dirName:
631            pathExport = os.path.join(self.dirName, img.name[:-4]+pref.getHDRdisplay()['post']+'.hdr')
632            img.type = hdrCore.image.imageType.HDR
633            img.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None
634            img.metadata.metadata['display'] = pref.getHDRdisplay()['tag']
635
636            img.write(pathExport)
637
638        if self.imageExportDone == self.imageToExport :
639            # turn off: autoResize
640            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = True
641        else:
642            pp = self.processPipes[self.imageExportDone]
643
644            if not pp:
645                img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(self.imagesName[self.imageExportDone], thumb=True)
646                pp = model.EditImageModel.buildProcessPipe()
647                pp.setImage(img)                      
648
649
650            # save current processpipe metada
651            originalImage = copy.deepcopy(pp.originalImage)
652            originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = pp.toDict()
653            originalImage.metadata.save()
654
655            # load full size image
656            img = hdrCore.image.Image.read(originalImage.path+'/'+originalImage.name)
657
658            # turn off: autoResize
659            hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe.autoResize = False 
660            # make a copy of selectedProcessPipe  
661            processpipe = copy.deepcopy(pp)
662
663            # set image to process-pipe
664            processpipe.setImage(img)
665
666            thread.cCompute(self.callBackEndAllExportHDR, processpipe, toneMap=False, progress=self.view.statusBar().showMessage)

693class EditImageController:
694
695    def __init__(self, parent=None, HDRcontroller = None):
696        """Initialize the MultiDockController with optional parent and HDR controller."""
697        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.__init__(",")")
698
699        self.parent = parent
700
701        self.previewHDR = True
702        self.controllerHDR = HDRcontroller
703
704        self.view = view.EditImageView(self)
705        self.model = model.EditImageModel(self)
706    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
707    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
708        """Set the current process pipe for the active panel.
709
710        Args:
711            processPipe: The process pipe to be loaded into the view.
712
713        Returns:
714            Result of setting the process pipe in the view.
715        """
716        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.setProcessPipe(",")")
717
718        if self.model.setProcessPipe(processPipe):
719
720            # update view
721            self.view.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
722            self.view.imageWidgetController.setImage(processPipe.getImage())
723
724            self.view.plotToneCurve()
725
726            # update hdr viewer
727            self.controllerHDR.displaySplash()
728
729            return True
730        else:
731            return False
732    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
733    def getProcessPipe(self) : 
734        """Return the currently active process pipe."""
735        return self.model.getProcessPipe()
736    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
737    def buildView(self,processPipe=None):
738        """Rebuild the view and optionally load a process pipe.
739
740        Args:
741            processPipe: Optional process pipe to initialize the view with.
742        """
743        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> EditImageController.buildView(",")")
744
745        """ called when MultiDockController recall a controller/view """
746        self.view = view.EditImageView(self, build=True)
747        if processPipe: self.setProcessPipe(processPipe)
748    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
749    def autoExposure(self): 
750        """Automatically compute optimal exposure and update the view and gallery preview."""

753      
754            img = self.model.autoExposure()
755
756            # update view with computed EV
757            paramDict = self.model.getEV()
758            self.view.exposure.setValue(paramDict['EV'])
759
760            qPixmap =  self.view.setImage(img)
761            self.parent.controller.parent.controller.view.imageGalleryController.setProcessPipeWidgetQPixmap(qPixmap)
762    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
