897class AdvanceSliderController():
898    def __init__(self, parent,name, defaultValue, range, step,callBackValueChange=None,callBackAutoPush= None):
899        """Initialize the slider with parameters and optional callbacks.
900
901        Args:
902            parent: Parent widget or controller.
903            name (str): Label for the slider.
904            defaultValue (float): Initial value.
905            range (tuple): Min and max range for the slider.
906            step (float): Step size for slider movement.
907            callBackValueChange (callable): Callback when value changes.
908            callBackAutoPush (callable): Callback when 'auto' is triggered.
909        """
910        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.__init__(",") ")
911        self.parent = parent
912
913        self.view = view.AdvanceSliderView(self,  name, defaultValue, range, step)
914        self.model = model.AdvanceSliderModel(self, value=defaultValue)
915
916        self.step = step
917        self.defaultValue = defaultValue
918        self.range = range
919
920        self.callBackActive = True
921        self.callBackValueChange = callBackValueChange
922        self.callBackAutoPush = callBackAutoPush
923    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
924    def sliderChange(self):
925        """Handle slider change, update value, and trigger callback."""
926        value = self.view.slider.value()*self.step
927
928        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.sliderChange(",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
929
930        self.model.value = value
931        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
932        if self.callBackActive and self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(value)
933    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
934    def setValue(self, value, callBackActive = True):
935        """Set the slider to a specific value.
936
937        Args:
938            value (float): New value to apply.
939            callBackActive (bool): Whether to trigger the change callback.
940        """
941        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> AdvanceSliderController.setValue(",value,") ")
942
943        """ set value value in 'model' range"""
944        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
945        self.view.slider.setValue(int(value/self.step))
946        self.view.editValue.setText(str(value))
947        self.model.setValue(int(value))
948
949        self.callBackActive = True
950    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
951    def reset(self):
952        """Reset the slider to its default value and trigger the callback."""
953        if pref.verbose : print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.reset(",") ")
954
955        self.setValue(self.defaultValue,callBackActive = False)
956        if self.callBackValueChange: self.callBackValueChange(self.defaultValue)
957    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
958    def auto(self):
959        """Trigger the auto-adjustment callback."""
960        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> AdvanceSliderController.auto(",") ")
961
962        if self.callBackAutoPush: self.callBackAutoPush()

 994        Args:
 995            key (str): The name of the tone range (e.g., 'shadows').
 996            value (float): The new value from the slider.
 997        """
 998        if pref.verbose: print(" [CB] >> ToneCurveController.sliderChange(",key,",",value,")[callBackActive:",self.callBackActive,"] ")
 999
1000        if self.callBackActive:
1001            newValues = self.model.setValue(key, value, autoScale = False)
1002            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(newValues) 
1003  
1004            points = self.model.evaluate()
1005
1006            self.callBackActive =  False
1007
1008            self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(newValues["shadows"][1]) * 100)
1009            self.view.editShadows.setText(str(round(newValues["shadows"][1],2)))
1010
1011            self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(newValues["blacks"][1]) * 100)
1012            self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(round(newValues["blacks"][1],2)))
1013
1014            self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(newValues["mediums"][1]) * 100)
1015            self.view.editMediums.setText(str(round(newValues["mediums"][1],2)))
1016
1017            self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(newValues["whites"][1]) * 100)
1018            self.view.editWhites.setText(str(round(newValues["whites"][1],2)))
1019
1020            self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(newValues["highlights"][1]) * 100)
1021            self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(round(newValues["highlights"][1],2)))
1022
1023            self.callBackActive =  True
1024    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1025    def setValues(self, valuesDict,callBackActive = False):
1026        """
1027        Set all tone curve control points programmatically.
1028
1029        Args:
1030            valuesDict (dict): Dictionary of control points.
1031            callBackActive (bool): Whether to enable slider callbacks during update.
1032        """
1033        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.setValue(",valuesDict,") ")
1034
1035        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1036
1037        self.model.setValues(valuesDict)
1038        points = self.model.evaluate()
1039
1040        self.view.sliderShadows.setValue(int(valuesDict["shadows"][1]) * 100)
1041        self.view.editShadows.setText(str(round(valuesDict["shadows"][1],2)))
1042
1043        self.view.sliderBlacks.setValue(int(valuesDict["blacks"][1]) * 100)
1044        self.view.editBlacks.setText(str(round(valuesDict["blacks"][1],2)))
1045
1046        self.view.sliderMediums.setValue(int(valuesDict["mediums"][1]) * 100)
1047        self.view.editMediums.setText(str(round(valuesDict["mediums"][1],2)))
1048
1049        self.view.sliderWhites.setValue(int(valuesDict["whites"][1]) * 100)
1050        self.view.editWhites.setText(str(round(valuesDict["whites"][1],2)))
1051
1052        self.view.sliderHighlights.setValue(int(valuesDict["highlights"][1])* 100)
1053        self.view.editHighlights.setText(str(round(valuesDict["highlights"][1],2)))
1054
1055        self.callBackActive = True
1056    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
1057    # zj add for semi-auto curve begin
1058    def autoCurve(self):
1059        """
1060        Automatically predict and apply a tone curve using a neural network model
1061        based on the image's lightness histogram.
1062        """
1063        processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
1064        if processPipe != None :
1065            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1066            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
1067
1068            imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
1069            imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
1070            imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1071            nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
1072            nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
1073
1074            npImgHistCumuNorm = np.empty_like(nphistBefore)
1075            npImgHistCumu = np.cumsum(nphistBefore)
1076            npImgHistCumuNorm = npImgHistCumu/np.max(npImgHistCumu)
1077            
1078            #predict keypoint value
1079            if self.networkModel == None:
1080                self.networkModel = Net(50,5)
1081                self.networkModel.load_state_dict(torch.load(self.weightFile))
1082                self.networkModel.eval()
1083
1084            with torch.no_grad():
1085                x = Variable(torch.FloatTensor([npImgHistCumuNorm.tolist(),]), requires_grad=True)
1086                y_predict = self.networkModel(x)
1087
1088            kpc = (y_predict[0]*100).tolist() 
1089            kpcDict = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,kpc[0]], 'blacks': [30.0,kpc[1]], 'mediums': [50.0,kpc[2]], 'whites': [70.0,kpc[3]], 'highlights': [90.0,kpc[4]], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
1090            self.setValues(kpcDict,callBackActive = True)
1091            self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(kpcDict) 
1092     
1093    # zj add for semi-auto curve end   
1094
1095    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1096    def reset(self, key):
1097        """
1098        Reset the tone curve point for a specific range to its default value.
1099
1100        Args:
1101            key (str): The name of the tone range to reset (e.g., 'shadows').
1102        """
1103        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ToneCurveController.reset(",key,") ")
1104
1105        valuesDefault = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default[key])[1]
1106        controls = self.model.setValue(key, valuesDefault)
1107        self.setValues(controls,callBackActive = False)
1108
1109        self.parent.controller.changeToneCurve(controls) 
1110    # -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1111    def plotCurve(self):
1112        """
1113        Plot the current tone curve and corresponding histograms in the UI,
1114        including optional overlays of input, before, and output images.
1115        """
1116        try:
1117            self.view.curve.plot([0,100],[0,100],'r--', clear=True)
1118            self.view.curve.plot([20,20],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1119            self.view.curve.plot([40,40],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1120            self.view.curve.plot([60,60],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1121            self.view.curve.plot([80,80],[0,100],'r--', clear=False)
1122
1123            processPipe = self.parent.controller.model.getProcessPipe()
1124            idExposure = processPipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
1125
1126            bins = np.linspace(0,1,50+1)
1127
1128            if self.showInput:
1129                imageInput = copy.deepcopy(processPipe.getInputImage())
1130                if imageInput.linear: imageInputColorData =colour.cctf_encoding(imageInput.colorData, function='sRGB')
1131                else: imageInputColorData = imageInput.colorData
1132                imageInputColorData[imageInputColorData>1]=1
1133                imageInputY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageInputColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1134                nphistInput  = np.histogram(imageInputY, bins)[0]
1135                nphistInput  = nphistInput/np.amax(nphistInput)
1136                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistInput*100,'k--',  clear=False)
1137
1138            if self.showbefore:
1139                imageBeforeColorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure-1].outputImage.colorData
1140                imageBeforeColorData[imageBeforeColorData>1]=1
1141                imageBeforeY = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageBeforeColorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1142                nphistBefore  = np.histogram(imageBeforeY, bins)[0]
1143                nphistBefore  = nphistBefore/np.amax(nphistBefore)
1144                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistBefore*100,'b--',  clear=False)
1145
1146            if self.showAfter:
1147                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.processNodes[idExposure].outputImage.colorData
1148                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
1149                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1150                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
1151                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
1152                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
1153
1154            if self.showOutput:
1155                imageAftercolorData = processPipe.getImage(toneMap=True).colorData
1156                imageAftercolorData[imageAftercolorData>1]=1
1157                imageAfterY  = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(imageAftercolorData,  apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1158                nphistAfter   = np.histogram(imageAfterY, bins)[0]
1159                nphistAfter   =nphistAfter/np.amax(nphistAfter)
1160                self.view.curve.plot(bins[:-1]*100,nphistAfter*100,'b',     clear=False)
1161
1162            controlPointCoordinates= np.asarray(list(self.model.control.values()))
1163            self.view.curve.plot(controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,0],controlPointCoordinates[1:-1,1],'ro', clear=False)
1164            points = np.asarray(self.model.curve.evalpts)
1165            x = points[:,0]
1166            self.view.curve.plot(points[x<100,0],points[x<100,1],'r',clear=False)
1167        except:
1168            time.sleep(0.5)
1169            self.plotCurve()

1214        self.model.setValues(values)
1215
1216        self.view.checkboxShadows.setChecked(values["shadows"])
1217        self.view.checkboxBlacks.setChecked(values["blacks"])
1218        self.view.checkboxMediums.setChecked(values["mediums"])
1219        self.view.checkboxWhites.setChecked(values["whites"])
1220        self.view.checkboxHighlights.setChecked(values["highlights"])   
1221
1222        self.callBackActive = True

Args: values (dict): Dictionary of mask booleans. callBackActive (bool): Whether to enable callbacks during the update.

class HDRviewerController: 
1226class HDRviewerController():
1227    def __init__(self, parent):
1228        """
1229        Initialize the HDR viewer controller.
1230
1231        Args:
1232            parent: Reference to the main application.
1233        """
1234        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> HDRviewerController.__init__(",")")
1235
1236        self.parent= parent
1237        self.model = model.HDRviewerModel(self)
1238        self.view = None 
1239
1240        self.viewerProcess = None
1241
1242        self.displaySplash()
1243
1244    def setView(self, view): 
1245        """
1246        Set the viewer's UI view.
1247
1248        Args:
1249            view: The viewer UI object.
1250        """
1251        self.view = view
1252
1253    def callBackUpdate(self):
1254        """
1255        Update the viewer with the currently selected image from the process pipe.
1256        """
1257        selectedProcessPipe = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1258        img = selectedProcessPipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
1259        self.displayIMG(img)
1260        self.model.currentIMG = img
1261
1262    def callBackAuto(self,on_off):
1263        """
1264        Enable or disable auto-preview in the HDR viewer.
1265
1266        Args:
1267            on_off (bool): Auto-preview state.
1268        """
1269        self.parent.view.dock.view.childControllers[0].model.autoPreviewHDR = on_off
1270
1271    def callBackCompare(self):
1272        """
1273        Compare the current HDR image with the updated result side-by-side.
1274        """
1275        if self.model.currentIMG:
1276            old = self.model.currentIMG
1277            old = old.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1278
1279            sp = self.parent.view.imageGalleryController.model.getSelectedProcessPipe()
1280            img = sp.getImage(toneMap = False)
1281            img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1282
1283
1284            h1, w1, _ = old.colorData.shape
1285            h2, w2, _ = img.colorData.shape
1286            hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1287            hM = int((hD - max(h1,h2))/2)
1288            wM = int((wD - (w1+w2))/3)
1289            back =  np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1290
1291            back[hM:hM+h1,wM:wM+w1,:] = old.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1292            back[hM:hM+h2,2*wM+w1:2*wM+w1+w2,:] = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1293
1294            # save as temp.hdr
1295            colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1296            self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1297
1298            self.model.currentIMG = img
1299        else: self.callBackUpdate()
1300
1301    def displayFile(self, HDRfilename):
1302        """
1303        HDRviewerController display file: run HDRImageViewer process ti display HDR image (from filename)
1304
1305        Args:
1306            HDRfilename: string
1307                Required  : hdr image filename
1308                
1309        """
1310
1311         # check that no current display process already open
1312        if self.viewerProcess:
1313            # the display HDR process is already running
1314            # close current
1315            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1316            time.sleep(0.05)
1317        # run display HDR process
1318        self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1319        time.sleep(0.10)
1320        psData = subprocess.run(['tasklist'], capture_output=True, universal_newlines=True).stdout
1321        if not 'HDRImageViewer' in psData: 
1322            # re-run display HDR process
1323            self.viewerProcess = subprocess.Popen(["HDRImageViewer.exe","-f", "-input:"+HDRfilename, "-f", "-h"], shell=True)
1324
1325    def displayIMG(self, img):
1326        """
1327        Process and display an in-memory HDR image using the external viewer.
1328
1329        Args:
1330            img: Image object to display.
1331        """
1332        img = img.process(hdrCore.processing.clip())
1333        colorData = img.colorData*self.model.displayModel['scaling']
1334
1335        h,w, _ = colorData.shape
1336        hD, wD = self.model.displayModel['shape']
1337
1338        if w<wD:
1339            back = np.ones((hD,wD,3))*0.2
1340            marginW = int((wD-w)/2)
1341            marginH = int((hD-h)/2)
1342
1343            back[marginH:marginH+h,marginW:marginW+w,:]=colorData
1344
1345        # save as temp.hdr
1346        colour.write_image(back,'temp.hdr', method='Imageio')
1347        self.displayFile('temp.hdr')
1348
1349    def displaySplash(self):
1350        """
1351        Display a default placeholder splash image in the HDR viewer.
1352        """
1353        self.model.currentIMG = None
1354        self.displayFile('grey.hdr')
1355
1356    def close(self):
1357        """
1358        Close the external HDR image viewer process, if running.
1359        """
1360        # check that no current display process already open
1361        if self.viewerProcess:
1362            # the display HDR process is already running
1363            # close current
1364            subprocess.run(['taskkill', '/F', '/T', '/IM', "HDRImageViewer*"],capture_output=False)
1365            self.viewerProcess = None

1464    def setValues(self, values, callBackActive = False):
1465        """
1466        Set all controller values from a dictionary.
1467
1468        Args:
1469            values (dict): Dictionary of values to set.
1470            callBackActive (bool): Whether to activate callbacks during setting.
1471        """
1472        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.setValue(",values,") ")
1473
1474        self.callBackActive = callBackActive
1475        # slider hue selection
1476        v = values['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,360)
1477        self.view.sliderHueMin.setValue(int(v[0]))
1478        self.view.sliderHueMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1479
1480        # slider chroma selection
1481        v = values['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1482        self.view.sliderChromaMin.setValue(v[0])
1483        self.view.sliderChromaMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1484
1485        # slider lightness
1486        v = values['selection']['lightness'] if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1487        self.view.sliderLightMin.setValue(int(v[0]*3))
1488        self.view.sliderLightMax.setValue(int(v[1]*3))
1489
1490        # hue shift editor
1491        v = values['edit']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1492        self.view.sliderHueShift.setValue(int(v))
1493        self.view.valueHueShift.setText(str(v)) 
1494
1495        # exposure editor
1496        v : int = values['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1497        self.view.sliderExposure.setValue(int(v*30))
1498        self.view.valueExposure.setText(str(v)) 
1499
1500        # contrast editor
1501        v : int = values['edit']['contrast'] if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1502        self.view.sliderContrast.setValue(int(v))
1503        self.view.valueContrast.setText(str(v))  
1504
1505        # saturation editor
1506        v : int = values['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1507        self.view.sliderSaturation.setValue(int(v))
1508        self.view.valueSaturation.setText(str(v))  
1509
1510        # mask
1511        v : bool = values['mask'] if 'mask' in values.keys() else False
1512        self.view.checkboxMask.setChecked(values['mask'])             
1513
1514        self.model.setValues(values)
1515
1516        self.callBackActive = True
1517
1518    # -----
1519    def resetSelection(self): 
1520        """
1521        Reset the selection values to default.
1522        """
1523        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> LchColorSelectorController.resetSelection(",") ")
1524
1525        default = copy.deepcopy(self.model.default)
1526        current = copy.deepcopy(self.model.getValues())
1527        
1528        current['selection'] = default['selection']
1529
1530        self.setValues(current,callBackActive = True)
1531        self.callBackActive = True
1532

1483        self.view.sliderChromaMax.setValue(int(v[1]))
1484
1485        # slider lightness
1486        v = values['selection']['lightness'] if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1487        self.view.sliderLightMin.setValue(int(v[0]*3))
1488        self.view.sliderLightMax.setValue(int(v[1]*3))
1489
1490        # hue shift editor
1491        v = values['edit']['hue'] if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1492        self.view.sliderHueShift.setValue(int(v))
1493        self.view.valueHueShift.setText(str(v)) 
1494
1495        # exposure editor
1496        v : int = values['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1497        self.view.sliderExposure.setValue(int(v*30))
1498        self.view.valueExposure.setText(str(v)) 
1499
1500        # contrast editor
1501        v : int = values['edit']['contrast'] if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1502        self.view.sliderContrast.setValue(int(v))
1503        self.view.valueContrast.setText(str(v))  
1504
1505        # saturation editor
1506        v : int = values['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1507        self.view.sliderSaturation.setValue(int(v))
1508        self.view.valueSaturation.setText(str(v))  
1509
1510        # mask
1511        v : bool = values['mask'] if 'mask' in values.keys() else False
1512        self.view.checkboxMask.setChecked(values['mask'])             
1513
1514        self.model.setValues(values)
1515
1516        self.callBackActive = True

Set all controller values from a dictionary.

Args: values (dict): Dictionary of values to set. callBackActive (bool): Whether to activate callbacks during setting.

def okCancelBox(title, text): 
1673def okCancelBox(title, text):
1674    """
1675    Display a confirmation dialog with OK and Cancel buttons.
1676
1677    Args:
1678        title (str): Title of the dialog.
1679        text (str): Message text to display.
1680
1681    Returns:
1682        int: The button selected by the user.
1683    """
1684    msg = QMessageBox()
1685    msg.setText(text)
1686    msg.setWindowTitle(title)
1687    msg.setStandardButtons(QMessageBox.Ok | QMessageBox.Cancel)
1688    msg.setEscapeButton(QMessageBox.Close)
1689    return msg.exec_()

class ColorEditorsAutoController: 
1693class  ColorEditorsAutoController:
1694    def __init__(self, parent, controlledColorEditors, stepName ):
1695        """
1696        Initialize the ColorEditorsAutoController.
1697
1698        Args:
1699            parent: The parent controller.
1700            controlledColorEditors (list): List of color editor controllers.
1701            stepName (str): Name of the processing step associated.
1702        """
1703        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.__init__(",") ")
1704
1705        self.parent = parent
1706        self.controlled = controlledColorEditors
1707        self.stepName =stepName
1708
1709        self.model =    model.ColorEditorsAutoModel(self, stepName,len(controlledColorEditors), removeBlack= True)
1710        self.view =     view.ColorEditorsAutoView(self)
1711
1712        self.callBackActive = True
1713    # callbacks
1714    def auto(self): 
1715        """
1716        Apply automatic color adjustments to all controlled editors.
1717        Resets each editor and assigns computed values from the model.
1718        """
1719        if pref.verbose: print(" [CONTROL] >> ColorEditorsAutoController.auto(",") ")
1720        for ce in self.controlled: ce.resetSelection(); ce.resetEdit()
1721        values = self.model.compute()
1722
1723        if values != None:
1724            for i,v in enumerate(values): self.controlled[i].setValues(v, callBackActive = False)
